comments.text:
One comment to add:

When I restart Firefox, all the tabs re-open automatically, so I don't loose my tabs, but still isn't how it should be, because when I'm used to close multiple tabs (even when the warning is working), I am doing so because I don't want to use them anymore. 

If Firefox "keeps is mind" my last used tabs is fine (as Opera used to do it), but then it should have an option to let the users disable this function.
comments.raw_text:

When I restart Firefox, all the tabs re-open automatically, so I don't loose my tabs, but still isn't how it should be, because when I'm used to close multiple tabs (even when the warning is working), I am doing so because I don't want to use them anymore. 

If Firefox "keeps is mind" my last used tabs is fine (as Opera used to do it), but then it should have an option to let the users disable this function.

At the tools menu -> options -> general panel there is the tag "When firefox starts" with several options next to it. So if you want to keep after restart the tabs and the windows you can choose the option "Show my windows and tabs from last time", if not then choose one of the other two.

Thank you,

It seems that when I choose the option proposed by you (e.g. "When Firefox starts: show my homepage"), solves the issue, so suddenly, the "Warn me when closing multiple tabs" is "working" again. 

It is logic, because why should the browser warn me that I close multiple tabs if I will find them anyway after restarting the browser. 

The problem was that during the update the "Show my windows and tabs from last time" was selected without my intervention. 

I think I can close this bug-report? though, not the most accurate solution has been found.
